DOC.brief_summary: The study is intended to assess the safety and efficacy of CO2 AcuPulse laser treatment in patients with urinary stress incontinence (USI). Eligible subjects will receive 3 treatment sessions, 4 weeks apart and 3 Follow Up visits, at 1, 3, and 6 months following the last treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Acupulse Laser Treatment on Urinary Stress Incontinence.
DOC.detailed_description: Following a screening visit and a urodynamic test, eligible subjects will be enrolled into the study. Eligibility will be decided depending on the level of USI the patient has. Each subject will receive 3 treatments 4 weeks apart and 3 Follow Up visits, at 1, 3, and 6 months following the last treatment. Further demographic information and patient history will be obtained from the subjects` electronical files.
DOC.criteria: Negative urine culture. Positive for USI in urodynamic testing. Normal Papanicolaou (PAP) test from the recent year. Negative for vaginal wall prolapse. Able and willing to comply with the treatment/followup schedule and requirements. Pregnant subjects. Subjects with repeated urinary tract infections or repeated infections with Candida or Herpes (more than twice a year). Previous surgery in the treatment area in the previous 9 months. Unexplained vaginal bleeding.
